Reviews.Title: HATE this monitor now (used to be love/hate)
Reviews.Author: Lauren Wu "Discerning Shopper"
Reviews.Content: 11/27/09 Update: I have posted my original monitor review below. Before, my only complaint was that it was "staticky" and I had to move the receiver around to positions where it wouldn't interfere with other devices. After about six months of use however, it made a loud permanent buzzing sound whenever I turned the volume on regardless of where it was placed. It was so annoying it was unusable. The only way it was tolerable if I turned on the video portion only but kept the sound off which didn't work for me since I'm not always looking at the monitor, especially at night when I'm sleeping!I called Mobicam to see if I could get a replacement but the length of their policy is something pathetic like a month.I ended up buying Summer Infant Deluxe Day & Night Handheld Color Video Monitor with 2.5" Screen - Blue (Infant Deluxe Day & Night Handheld Color Video Monitor with 2.5" Screen) as a replacement which I'm MUCH happier with even though it as it's own drawbacks. I will also write a review for that.5/9/09: Love/hate relationship with this monitor (Original Review)We had our heart set on a video monitor (not just an audio one) and it was between this and Summer. We decided on this one because of the Internet option so we could see our little guy from work.When the monitor works, it works FANTASTICALLY. We can see our baby both during the day and at night due to the infrared. I like being able to see his eyes -- if they are closed, I leave him be even if he's whimpering/crying because it means he'll be able to go back to sleep on his own. If they are open, I go to to see what's bothering him.That was the love part. The hate part is that there is static galore. The monitor flickers and buzzes even if you place anything near it -- it doesn't even have to be anything electrical in nature, the screen fizzes out even if you put your hand by the monitor. If you have a wireless phone, it will crackle louder than the TV in Poltergeist. It is super annoying and I spent a lot of time finding the perfect spot to place the monitor where it wouldn't be affected by anything and where I could still see it.We have our unit on continuous video monitoring so we always plug it into an A/C outlet, otherwise, we would go through way too many batteries.I wish we could purchase another video monitor so we can leave one in our room and put one downstairs.As of now, we haven't really used the Internet option. If that feature isn't important to you, I would try the Summer unit instead since that's the one our friends recommend and it seems to have pretty good reviews on Amazon.

Reviews.Title: Do NOT buy this monitor!  Consider yourself warned.
Reviews.Author: sc_demandred
Reviews.Content: My wife bought this monitor so that we could keep an eye on our sleeping baby when we're not in the room.It seemed at first like a decent product, but has today revealed itself to be a terrible one.PROS:Night vision mode automatically comes on, allowing video monitoring of your baby at night.CONS:Poor battery life if using batteries.Terrible interference problems, and not just with computers or lamps, but with inanimate objects or nothing at all - maybe ghosts??Camera has a TINY range of motion, limiting the places you can put it and still see the baby.Cheaply made and too lightweight - if you don't have batteries in the camera, the mere weight of the the cord is enough to pull it out of alignment.UNFORGIVABLE CON:It broke; it now emits a constant 60-cycle hum at any volume except the lowest possible, which makes it useless for monitoring your baby's sounds.  Several reviews on here indicate that this is a permanent problem.  This product is abysmal, and no one should buy it.  The people who have not yet experienced problems, will eventually, I am convinced. F-----, DO NOT BUY.

Reviews.Title: Good, BUT...
Reviews.Author: Jessica Reading
Reviews.Content: So, I recieved this monitor as a gift at my baby shower. I recieved a total of 4 baby monitors, but since this was the only video one, I kept it and returned the others. I had no idea how comforting it would be to have a video monitor! It's great to be able to see him when he makes noise, and to see if he's just fussing or needs me or whatever. The night vision works great, but the colors are muted with the daytime view. Not a big deal, as far as I'm concerned because you can still see baby well. Does have occasional issues with static, but sometimes you just have to move around the monitor or camera and the problem can be solved. (Surprised that we've only had minimal issues with interference given all of the electronics/cordless devices in our home).Here comes the BUT... part:So, we've been using the monitor for six months now, and this morning it stopped working. We've had occasional problems where you would switch it on, and there would be no power to the monitor.  Sometimes it took a couple of times and it would come on. (This is using the DC adapter, not batteries). I tried everything to get it to come on, switching outlets, putting batteries in, and nothing. So, I called Mobi directly (since it was a gift, I didn't know where it was from. I didn't have a reciept, or fill out a warranty card. So I took my chances and called them. What could they do? Say no?) I talked to a guy named Andy, super nice and understanding. I am to ship my monitor to him, and he'll bench test it. If it doesn't work, he'll send me a new one. Fair enough.So, I guess that's why I'm giving it four stars, instead of three. Customer service on Mobi's part seems well worth it. I guess we'll see what happens in a few days when I get it back!

Reviews.Title: Doesn't Do As Much As Expected
Reviews.Author: mkhollis
Reviews.Content: 5 pros, 6 cons = decent, but just ok, baby monitor systemI bought this camera to replace a Summer baby monitor (also video, but the rechargable battery isn't holding much of a charge after 2 years), mainly because it had the internet feature & can watch 2 monitors at once.The Good1. The setup is easy (as with all monitors).2. Picture is clear, day or night.3. Sound is clear.4. It can monitor camera 1, camera 2, or you can make it toggle between 2 cameras.5. It does not interfer with our wireless network or wireless digital Panasonic phones (why I got this 900mHz version instead of the 2.4G version as reviewed complained about).The Bad:1. The angle for the camera is odd. Think about it -- camera for toddler near floor = asking for trouble. The camera lens will angle up but not down. When I place it higher on a bookshelf, I have to lie the camera on its side to be able to adjust the angle downward so I can see into the crib. I definitely can't mount it on the wall like the Summer unit. BTW, lying the camera on its side affects the night vision, so you have to have it at the very edge of the shelf, practically leaning over the edge.2. The monitor unit eats batteries! It takes SIX AA's in just the monitor unit, and after 1 week of occasional use (about 4-5 hours total?) I had to replace them. So, a little constraining to have to drag the AC plug around to different parts of the house.3. The internet connection feels like a rip off. You only get TWO hours of monitoring per MONTH unless you want to pay $9.95/month! If I buy an internet hookup, I expect to be able to watch my monitor any time or have my family be able to watch any time as well.4. The internet connection is awkward. You have to hook up the physical monitor to a computer constantly with a bunch of wires & adapters. So, at night (when I actually use the monitor), I have a choice of having the monitor hooked up to my computer OR be able to watch the monitor next to my bed. Who wants a computer running next to their bed all the time with a tangled mess of wires?5. The voice-activation feature is quite annoying if you have it on while you are sleeping. It sounds like it is having interference constantly, is quite loud with the static, and blinks the monitor on & off. This may be fine if you are recording, but I don't have a need for that feature.6. It was made in China, so it seems a little cheap. Several times the button for switching the cameras has gotten stuck so that I had to pry it out with a screwdriver.In all, I like the fact that it will switch between cameras (planning for baby #2 now), so I will keep it. I am sorely disappointed that I got the internet hookup though. I wish I had gotten the extra camera instead for the same price.If you just need 1 camera & no internet, go for the Summer baby video monitor. It works great!

Reviews.Title: This thing has issues!
Reviews.Author: M. D. Edwards "Ubercrafting hip Mommy"
Reviews.Content: I usually don't take time to write reviews, but I had to on this one.  This has been the only monitor I have had for almost 4 months since my daughter was born.  No matter WHAT I did I had constant interference.  I unplugged all of the cordless phones and WiFi... anything that made sense for the problem.  It got better, but still constant "police radio" noises came out of it.  I could not sleep through this and was at my wits end.  I found that there is a mode that the monitors are in standby until she cries, so that was better but when the sound subsides and it stops sending the god awful police radio sound LOUDLY blasts from the monitor.  I already had to leave the thing in another room to try to sleep through that, but all my daughter would do was sniffle and inevitably that is what woke me up.. the monitor. Oh and this is just being in the next room... it isn't like we are far away.  I finally bought a nice digital Graco today and it is totally silent.  No, there is no video but we aren't currently using the video anyway.  I hated how the bright light shines right in my daughters face for the night vision... I can't see that that will help her sleep at all.  When she is older and moving around, I might turn the audio OFF and just use it for video.. when I can see through the static. Oh and it will DRAIN your batteries if you want to tote it around constantly on.. you will be buying 4 AA batteries for each every day.  if you use the mode where it turns on when they cry I am sure it will last longer... and if you don't use the video.  Basically, it is NOT a good monitor if you want to spend time outside.  It is also very heavy and cumbersome to carry in your pocket.I also bought the part to hook it up to the internet.  The software, camera and computer refuse to talk to each other.  The software is old.So, I generally hate this thing and if I had purchased it myself at the store I would have taken it back.  Buyer beware.

Reviews.Title: Great Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: zandy "Zandy P"
Reviews.Content: I bought the Mobi Cam on amazon at a great price ($50 less than the MSRP) and I'm impressed with the performance so far.  We were using an old Graco baby monitor (not a video) so this is a huge upgrade for us.  We were able to plug-n-play very easily.  The picture is VERY clear - i can see the whites of my baby's eyes from more than 6 feet with the night vision.  And the audio portion is great - I can hear my baby breathing!  We use this unit in our single family home and there is no static or interference.  Occasionally we'll get a little static but that only happens once per week or so -- realy nothing to even complain about.  We only use these units with the AC adapterts, so I can't comment on the battery-life.  I love this unit and would definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: there are better monitors out there
Reviews.Author: Mary SB "Mary SB"
Reviews.Content: Purchased the mobicam shortly after our son was born, and was initially pleased -- good daytime and night-time view.  However, the static and interference was horrible.  I couldn't sleep with the volume turned on b/c the static woke me up over and over.  Then, after 4.5 months, the night vision stopped working, which to me is the whole point of having a monitor.  We purchased the Summer Best View monitor today and it works 1000 times better.  NO STATIC!! Great picture. Don't waste your money with the mobicam -- spend a little extra and get one that won't disappoint.

Reviews.Title: Mobi Cam even sees the baby in the dark
Reviews.Author: Lois
Reviews.Content: I bought the Mobi Cam for my first granddaughter.  My daughter and son-in-law live in a 3 story town house and they did buy a monitor but only with sound.  When I saw this I thought it would save them the trip of running up circular stairs just to check on the baby.  Anyone who has a new baby knows that you are always running to "check on the baby" with every sound they make.  Well, when they installed the Mobi Cam they loved it .... This even shows the baby in the dark bedroom!!  No more wondering if the baby is just fussing or really needs your attention.  This works!

Reviews.Title: garbage
Reviews.Author: LZ "skydivr1976"
Reviews.Content: This product is garbage.  If you get the monitor more than 15 feet away from the camera it buzzes, snaps, and hisses.  Everytime our baby would move it would make a snapping sound.  The video quality was horrible.  The one neat thing was the night vision.  I returned mine after one day.  I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Faulty design
Reviews.Author: Angie
Reviews.Content: As other people mentioned, the camera looks like it could be tilted in any direction, but that is not the case. It only tilts up and slightly down. I couldn't for the life of me get the camera to see my son without actually putting it in the crib. I returned it right away and is currently using a monitor from my brother until I find one that works for me.

Reviews.Title: Good Monitor
Reviews.Author: Branden E. Hudson
Reviews.Content: This monitor works well. The only drawback is that it has a short range and if you have other wireless devices in your house (Wireless network, wireless phones, etc) it picks up interference and you get static.

Reviews.Title: junk
Reviews.Author: cyndisull
Reviews.Content: This item lasted us about a month, before it stopped working completely. From the start, the picture was horrible, it would freeze up and the sound was of poor quality!  I highly recommend not purchasing this product. Go with a Summer Infant monitor. We did, and have been happy with it for over a year now!

Reviews.Title: I have loved this monitor for 2 years after going through 4 junk monitors
Reviews.Author: Melissa J. Myers "Mom of 2 princesses in CO"
Reviews.Content: I had originally purchased a video monitor (don't remember the brand).  On the first night it made so much static, even with the volume at the lowest point that we couldn't sleep.  We returned it and paid more for the Summer monitor with the big screen.  It made a VERY loud constant static noise on the lowest sound setting.  I finally turned the volume off and used a separate regular monitor for sound and just used the screen on the Summer.  After about 2 weeks the monitor quit working.  I returned it to Babies R Us (who were great about the whole thing by the way).  I got the same Summer monitor.  I brought it home.  Same thing, 2 weeks later it quit working...of course on the night that my daughter puked for the first time.  I went back at 8:00 p.m. and exchanged it once again only to get home, and the brand new Summer monitor didn't work at all.  I took it back the next day and got my money back.  I went to Walmart and saw the Mobi video monitor.  I was reluctant to buy it because it was so inexpensive, around $99.00 which was about $60 less than the Summer.  I have had it for 2 years now.  It does have a slight static sound every once in awhile but nothing I can't live with.  Considering the 2 other monitors that were junk this one has been amazing.  Having 2 kids, and being clumsy myself, the part of the monitor that has the screen has been dropped numerous times and keeps on working.  I just had my first problem with it.  It only works with batteries.  I called Mobi, the girl on the phone was so nice and helped me troubleshoot it. It turns out, the cord was broken and they are sending me a new cord.  I have to pay $6.00 for shipping because I didn't save my receipt but if I had it they would have sent it for free.  Seems fair to me.  Overall I would definitely highly recommend this monitor!  It has a great color picture, great night vision, and unbelievable picture when plugged into the TV.  Mobi also has great customer service.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: C. Marks
Reviews.Content: There are NO rechargeable batteries.There is LOUD static, especially when using the voice activated picture.Returned and went with Summer brand which is definitely better.

Reviews.Title: I've had enough!
Reviews.Author: sadiesmommy
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor after researching and reading reviews.  I gave it one star because it has a great picture for day and night!  The cons are many.--My receiver will not work on the battery and must be plugged in if I move it to the living room during the day.  I contacted the company and was told that the video runs down the battery and I should not leave the video on---um, that is why I bought a video monitor.  They offered to send me a new one but it would ruin the battery if I left the video on again.--We he have WIFI and wireless phones in our house, like most these days, and I have static problems.  It will work fine for a few hours and then I will be awaken by several bits of static that just do not go away.  I move the monitor around on my night stand but it does not help.  I have 3 children....I do not need the monitor waking me up several times at night.--The monitor will be working fine until someone stands in front of it or walks in it's path.I have had enough with the static and am going back to my old sound-only monitor for now.

Reviews.Title: Review update: will be replacing with another brand
Reviews.Author: Lisa W "Lisa W"
Reviews.Content: Feb 2010 Update:After about 4 to 4 1/2 months of use, the sound has started to short out & come in and out on this monitor. That coupled with all the other picture issues, interference, etc, is now forcing us to purchase a different brand of monitor. Very disappointed.Original review:I got the Mobi over the other popular brand based on good reviews online and I needed a 2nd camera because I have twins. Unfortunately, although it works and does not short out on me or have insane amounts of static, so it is tolerable, it has several shortcomings that have been very frustrating. But first, I will say the customer service is great- I wrote to the company about the camera quality and they emailed me back quickly & they promptly sent me a new camera free of charge. Unfortunately it was no better than the first but I thought that was really nice!!!!1. The tilt of the camera is very frustrating. I can only get about half the crib in the view with the camera on the side of the crib. I have no idea where I would mount it with the limited tilt to get a better view.2. The button that switches between the cameras on the first one I got quickly became jammed and therefore unusable. I returned it for a new set.3. Apparently Mobi changed their cameras recently and not for the better. My second camera, purchased separately, is extremely clear/sharp, in daytime it is in color, it is really a wonderful picture (not quite what the promo photo makes it out to be but pretty good I think!). Unfortunately the camera that came in the package and the new one they sent me are terrible in comparison. They are not in color during the day and the picture is very grainy/dark/fuzzy all the time. I can see my daughter but cannot see the details like her features, or the details of the mobile in her crib, etc like I can with the camera in my son's crib. If I turn up the brightness to help with that camera, the other one gets too bright & I can't see the picture, and vice versa with the darkness.4. On the flip side- the 'good' camera has way more interference (the 'bad' one has no interference at all)- if I am on our cordless phone near the receiver, there is a lot of interference noise, and if it is sitting next to me while I'm on my laptop, there is staticky noise when I do things like scroll down & click on various links. Very strange. Also I have noticed that my body can mess with the reception but that is easy to fix by just shifting the receiver a little bit.So that being said, I wouldn't really recommend it since there are other competitors that I have heard better things about, but it isn't terrible.

Reviews.Title: Buy at your Own Risk!!!
Reviews.Author: C. Price
Reviews.Content: This product seems like it would be really great but it's not! Sure it's nice to have a picture of the baby but I found that it was more important to hear the baby and I ended up not using the video part at all. This product is very cheaply made and I was extremely disappointed with all the interference. We tried everything to lessen the interference, by keeping away from computers and other things. It would still make popping noises for no reason and then it started to make a really loud buzzing noise that would not go away. We couldn't even hear the baby through it! Even if these things didn't happen, I still would not care for it! It's way too expensive for what it is! I am returning this and I already bought a nice cheaper monitor for $30 dollars and it works GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Disappointing
Reviews.Author: J. Hall
Reviews.Content: Bought this and when it came out of the box seemed a little cheap. It worked ok as long as you held it very still - lots of static if you walked around with it. I decided to buy a different type of camera and compare it as I thought maybe that is as good as the portable monitors get and figured I would return the one that was the worst. I couldn't believe the difference! The other monitor we purchased was 100% better and I couldn't believe this one was rated over a 1 or 2 on amazon. The Mobi Mobicam was like a childs toy compared with the other monitor we bought. Very happy with my decision to return this product.

Reviews.Title: Buy another monitor
Reviews.Author: research B4U buy
Reviews.Content: I researched monitors online and this one was the second highest rated video monitor.  I was very displeased with this product when it arrived.  There is a lot of interference when someone gets up and move around the room.  You have to put the product one foot away from baby to see what he or she is doing.  I have it on top of a dresser (about waist level) at the end of my child's crib and she looks like a lump.  You can't tell which way she is facing or what she is doing.  We are going to buy another audio video monitor since this one is substandard.  Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Not Just for Monitoring Babies!
Reviews.Author: Christine Talbert "Dive Goddess"
Reviews.Content: Thanks MobiCam.  We have a detached garage and where robbed while we slept.  Wanted a quick solution to monitoring garage quickly.  MobiCam is perfect.  It has good picture day or night and great sound.  Now we sleep knowing the garage is monitored.  I feel for the bad guys, next time the free tools and bikes are gonna come with a free side of Glock lead!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Monitor
Reviews.Author: S. Chung
Reviews.Content: The MobiCam is excellent. The picture quality is not perfect (a little pixelated and color is a little off) but it does what it's suppose to do. We can monitor our baby without having to go into her room. The only thing is that it doesn't point down so it takes a bit of creativity to position it. The reception is not bad and the night vision works very well.We also purchased the Internet Kit. It is fantastic! We can hook it up to the computer and broadcast the streaming on the web. There's also a recording feature. We recorded our 3 month old over night just to see how she sleeps. She does the funniest things to sooth herself.Overall, I'm really glad we purchased the MobiCam and Internal Kit.

Reviews.Title: MobiCam Rocks!
Reviews.Author: Bobbie Grob "BobbieGrob"
Reviews.Content: I didn't buy or request a baby monitor when I was pregnant because we live in a very small condo, and I knew I'd be able to hear the baby from any room in the house.  What I didn't count on, however, was the noises she would make and how they would sound in the middle of the night.  What was just cooing during the day sounded like gasping for breath once darkness fell, and I was becoming frazzled running back and forth to the crib.I bought the Mobi not expecting much, because it was so inexpensive.  I just needed something with a picture so I could see what my daughter was doing, but I was really impressed with this video monitor.  It has a terrific colored picture and shows the baby in real time, so I can tell if she's kicking and wide awake or just moving in her sleep.  The night vision shows up in black and white, but the picture is very clear, and has allowed me to stay in bed at night instead of running to her side ten times a night.I would recommend this product to anyone.  Even though it was the least expensive model, it works just as well (if not better) than the more expensive models my friends and family use.  I have not used the battery funtion since I keep it plugged in on the nightstand, but I am confident that if I do need to use the batteries and carry my Mobi around, it will not disappoint me.

Reviews.Title: worth every penny
Reviews.Author: Lilly Lopez "Lilly"
Reviews.Content: This monitor is great. I can watch my daughter from downstairs and know that she is in her bed or playing and if she is really crying for me or just falling asleep. It is so great and worth every penny. Great Picture and Sound.

Reviews.Title: Great picture, ok in every other way
Reviews.Author: Diane
Reviews.Content: I let my husband, the techie chose the baby monitor. I'll start by saying it has a fantastic picture.  Very clear even in low light.  Convenient size for taking from room to room.  There is an optional wi-fi connector so that you can broadcast to your own computers or across the internet to family.The downside: the camera doesn't rotate down very far.  If you are planning on setting it on a table next to the crib, it won't work.  We had to hang it from a curtain rod to get a view of the inside of the crib.  If you plan to carry the monitor around with you, buy rechargable batteries.  The battery life is only about 2 days with minimal use.  I try to keep it plugged in if at all possible.  There is a brightness level on the side of the monitor; ours never worked.  It affects the contrast minimally but the not the brightness which leaves it VERY bright at night when I'm trying to sleep.So overall, I like it.  It just needs some finessing.

Reviews.Title: it's $16 cheaper on HAPPYMOTHERS website
Reviews.Author: Zbird's Mom "Rebecca"
Reviews.Content: go to the HAPPYMOTHERS website and enter coupon code HAPPYMOTHERS for a free gift and the same product for $16 less than available here.

Reviews.Title: Caution, Please read....
Reviews.Author: Edith Chilelli
Reviews.Content: Anyone considering purchasing this monitor should be aware that the seller (Health Checks Systems) will charge you a 10% 're-stocking fee' if you are not happy with it and make a return. I purchased an additional camera making my total $158. After the fee and the cost of sending it back, I spent $25 to find out that it does not work as advertised.For me, it worked fine if the monitor was just outside the room where the camera was but went blank when I walked just a few feet from the door. Additionally, the camera is deceiving. As other reviews point out, from appearances it looks like the round camera can be turned to point in any direction but that is not the case. It can only be tilted up and down slightly so unless the camera is placed on the same level as your child you will not be able to get a good viewing angle.

Reviews.Title: great visual monitor!
Reviews.Author: sapna lahiff "little e mommy"
Reviews.Content: i am really enjoying this product - the picture quality is great including the night vision.  it is very easy to travel with as well.

Reviews.Title: Everyone is wrong and stupid about this
Reviews.Author: Jordan
Reviews.Content: I've never felt compelled to write a review before, but the people who are complaining about interference on this are flat out wrong.  I had the same problems everyone else had.  Including the illusion that "inanimate objects" cause static too. But I fixed this problem in about 5 minutes. Here are a few tips.1. I looked at my wireless devices' frequencies in the house.  This monitor runs on 900mhz. That is a good thing.  900 mhz is a very unpopular frequency these days, which shouldn't have to much interference in your home. However, old devices will be really effected this. A cordless phone @ 900 mhz will effect this terribly.  My phone was a 5+ ghz.  Didn't solve it.  Then I looked at my wireless speakers.  It was 900 mhZ. Unplugged them, and presto-change-o, no interference!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!2.  You can also tie the cord in a knot (that is easy to untie!) to create a feedback loop.  This will VERY *slightly* change the frequency, like changing a channel on a cordless phone.  Don't expect to solve your problems with this, but it will help if all other wireless interference is gone.3.  The same goes for wireless security cameras, headphones too.  Maybe even wireless video game controler too, get creative in finding the source.People who have beef with this device either:a.  Have a device I just mentioned.b.  Are using this monitor at least 3 stories apart or just through too many walls.  No monitor will carry much more range strength than another.  If you have a range strength problem DO NOT USE BATTERIES.  You need the full 9 volt AV power to get the signal through long distances, concrete, etc..c.  Live in an apartment with neighbors who are using a device mentioned above. If that is the case.  You might be up a creek, unless you can pin-point it and coordinate with what frequencies you are both on.  This sounds crazy, but they could be having problems with their devices that they would want to solve too.  Mobicam now makes a "digilock" frequency that they claim will fix this.  Do your own research on this frequency. I couldn't find it online.d.  Note that the people who are complaining about computer wifi interference must be using a 900mhz router.  I didn't know those EVER existed.  They are just wrong. The only way a computer or another electronic could affect this is if you had it close enough to cause an electromagnetic interferences, not a frequency one. It would have to be really close.So this review is in part too help the general public by informing them.  But it's more to just show-off and prove how great I am to an anonymous, general community that will never give me the gratification that I deserve.  God,  I am such a loser.UPDATE:  Tonight I have heard a few static buzzes as my wife walked by it, but got no more of a static buzz then a radio or cordless phone would have.  Otherwise, this thing is pretty sweet.

Reviews.Title: bad experience
Reviews.Author: A. Yampolskiy "Alex Y."
Reviews.Content: I've had a bad experience with the Mobicam monitor.The sound interference is terrible and I hear static all the time. When I decrease volume to reduce static, I could not hear the baby crying.The video is rather glitchy.Overall, I would not recommend this product.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Lucy Garate Barros
Reviews.Content: We bought this product because it offered the option of Internet connection so our daughter's grandparents could see her.  We got excited when we got the box but unfortunately the monitor didn't work at all.  The cameras were working, so we called the company and they sent us a new monitor (so Services is OK).  We thought it was just bad luck that we got the bad monitor, so we were still excited about the monitoring system when we got the replacement.  Unfortunately, this time we were disappointed as well.  THe monitor did turn on, but only to show a good image for one second and then static the next one, then back to the good image, and back again the to static again.  It seems that the monitor kept changing channels only to return to the nice image again.  And it kept doing that which was frustrating.  So we decided to return it and get another one.

Reviews.Title: no good
Reviews.Author: Danielle
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately the monitor stopped working day 3. I was so disappointed because it was finally an affordable video monitor. After much debate I opted to pay more & get summer infant one. So far I am very pleased with my decision.

Reviews.Title: Great Value
Reviews.Author: John Elledge
Reviews.Content: Great value! It's fun to watch the baby wake up! Clear picture and plenty of reception throughout the entire house.

Reviews.Title: Look for something else
Reviews.Author: Mommy of 2
Reviews.Content: I purchased this because the price was right. It's terrible. The video part works great but it has constant static and if you walk between the imaginary line that link the monitors the static gets louder & the video is interrupted. And battery power is dead after 15 minutes.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY THIS!!! Only worked badly for 6 months then stopped turning on!
Reviews.Author: Frustrated Mom
Reviews.Content: This static on this monitor was too loud to leave the volume on at night so we had to buy an additional monitor just to hear our little one. That being said, at least the picture worked - FOR 6 MONTHS!!! Then it just stopped turning on. Please don't waste your time or money!!!

Reviews.Title: Excelente
Reviews.Author: Luis Eloy Hernandez
Reviews.Content: El producto llegó a tiempo, sin contratiempos, sin problemas el producto de muy buena calidad. La atención del vendedor muy buena

Reviews.Title: excelente
Reviews.Author: Alexander Astua Gonzalez
Reviews.Content: excel ente pro duct o, ta ma ño pe so se gún espe cifica ciones entreg a a tiem po

Reviews.Title: Cuts out and bad static screen
Reviews.Author: Ashley
Reviews.Content: I returned this right when i got it. First off it sucks!!! It cuts out constently even when your in one spot or even same room. Its very bulky and to small of a screen. Never would recommand!!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good.
Reviews.Author: Odilon
Reviews.Content: I've had the monitor for over a year now, and it works well enough. It has a nice feature that it turns on only when the baby makes some noise, witch works pretty well and we don't have sleep with the light of the monitor on. It gets some interference though.

Reviews.Title: Worst. Monitor. Ever.
Reviews.Author: Stephanie Campana
Reviews.Content: Like other reviewers mention, this monitor started out just ok and went steadily downhill from there.(a) the static. It's not a low hum, its so loud you simply cannot even have it on. And if you could stomach the annoying sound, why keep it on because you can't hear your baby over the static?(b) the video picture. It is NOT color, at least not mine, and basically at night my son looks like a blob -- you can possibly detect movement but that is about it. (Interestingly enough, I can get my NEIGHBOR's baby's room in full color and clear picture. But that channel doesn't work -- AT ALL -- at my house. It is a blank blue screen)(c) the irregularity. It will be working fine, then at 3am it will decide to short out. Being a sleep deprived parent, when a loud static wakes you up at 3am when you finally CAN sleep, it is maddening.Point blank: Do not waste your money on this product.

Reviews.Title: Started out just ok, then went ALL BAD.
Reviews.Author: MommyofTwo
Reviews.Content: I bought this monitor because I just wanted something simple (and cheap) with vision to watch my toddler in his room once we transitioned him out of the crib...to make sure he was staying in bed at nighttime and wasn't getting into anything he shouldn't be when he woke up in the mornings. It was nice because at night I could turn the vision off once he was asleep and just keep the sound on like a normal audio monitor. However, there are many more cons than pros on this system.PROS:1. Night vision worked well.2. Ability to switch from audio to video whenever needed was nice.3. Price was very low compared to most video monitors. But...you get what you pay for. I was hoping I would get lucky, I suppose.CONS:1. Very lightweight; we never used it with batteries because it was sucking the life out of the batteries within days, so we always kept it plugged in. The weight of the plug itself will pull the camera around and makes it tough to position to where you want.2. Using plugs all the time also means you don't really have a cordless unit to watch...unplugging and re-plugging the unit to whatever room you need it in is a pain and cumbersome.3. Camera's vertical position with limited mobility or adjustment options doesn't allow you to easily position to watch your kid. This is especially true if you plan to keep it up higher on a shelf where the kid can't reach it or play with it. We had to lay our camera down on its belly to see anything and even then it wasn't exactly right. This laying down position also made it even harder for it to stay in place with the plug pulling on it.4. After almost exactly one year of "ok" use, it one day just crapped out. The video portion still worked but the audio turned into a loud continuous buzz/hum that I am now reading in all the other reviews. Makes the unit completely worthless when you really only use the video in rare cases and the audio is the more important/more often used part. When we called the manufacturer, the CS rep told us that it would cost us $56 to send it in and have it fixed...ha ha! The unit itself cost right around $90 so completely not worth it. What a waste of money.I'm now buying my THIRD baby monitor and hopeful to get a good one this time without spending a fortune. Wish me luck!

Reviews.Title: Terrible quality, don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Nina Iacono
Reviews.Content: This monitor went from bad to worse.  It worked alright for a very limited time (a few weeks?) and then things started to go wrong. First the A/C adaptor failed. The company was very willing to replace it--at full cost. Then we started hearing a noise (like interference) whenever the volume was on, however slight. We could manipulate where the monitor was and sometimes get the noise to go away, but after about 1-2 weeks nothing worked. We now use the monitor on video only; when you have any volume at all, the terrible ear-piercing static and interference noise is to unbearable.I should also note that the range isn't very good, and there are even areas in our house where you can't get a picture.Honestly, don't waste your money. I'm shopping for a replacement monitor right now.

Reviews.Title: Loud, low-functioning battery-hog...choose another monitor
Reviews.Author: Nicole804
Reviews.Content: We liked this monitor at first, the picture is clear and both ends of the devices are small and functional.  However, it soon became almost useless because of the static feedback and alarming rate at which it guzzled batteries, even with the LCD off!  Then we took it on vacation where we shared a house with other couples using monitors.  Ours picked up images of their neighbors cribs!!!  And then failed to work altogether because of the interference.  Two other couples with other brands of monitors said theirs were working fine.  I wish we returned it a long time ago when the static drove us crazy, we won't be using it for any future kids. My advice would be to buy another brand or monitor.

Reviews.Title: Buy a different brand
Reviews.Author: Amber
Reviews.Content: I didn't have spectacular hopes for this monitor because it was one of the cheaper ones out there. It pretty much failed even my low expectations though. First of all either the camera part or the monitor part, I can't remember which, didn't even come with it's cord. We had to use batteries to use it. There was so much static, forget trying to use the sound. The picture does not come in most of the time. When it did come in, it came in for a few seconds and flickered back to a blue screen, and bounced back and forth between the two. The angling of the camera is awkward. You would literally have to mount this hanging off the ceiling from across your babies room to even be able to see your baby.  This Monitor was a total waist of money.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good, but some issues.
Reviews.Author: rhart
Reviews.Content: This was great while my baby was still immobile. Now that she's 11 months we're having some logistical issues. For the camera to be able to see her, it has to be within her reach, and she pushes the buttons or unplugs it. If it's across the room (an 8x8 room) she's a blurry blob. I tried to mount it higher, but the lens doesn't point down low enough to see her.It also makes an annoying, electric humming noise whenever it wants. Luckily our house is small so I can keep it on silent and still hear her. If you plan to sleep with it turned up, you'd better be good at blocking out distractions.We've had it a year, and now it'll switch channels on its own like it's possessed. The picture comes and goes as the channel switches from A to B over and over. I expected it to last longer than this before punking out.

Reviews.Title: Save yourself a headache
Reviews.Author: Claudia
Reviews.Content: I bought this equipment from Amazon, including the additional camera and the internet kit for which I paid over $300. I was really disappointed as it is poorly designed and it has a lot of static so you have to set it to the lowest volume possible so you can sleep... but without listenting to the baby too!!! Even though, I still can say it had its moments were you could actually get to see 5 seconds using the internet application. However, I changed my laptop and when I tried to re-install it again we realized we didn't have the serial numbers. I wrote to the customer service and they don't even bothered to reply saying it was not possible to recover it. Now I have a very expensive plain monitor that I can't connect to the web and I could have got a much better equipment for that money.

Reviews.Title: Useless
Reviews.Author: Danielle "Danielle"
Reviews.Content: We gave up using our MobiCam.  It produced a constant on and off static sound that we found impossible to sleep with.  Other times we would lose sound and picture completely.

Reviews.Title: No problems, great monitor
Reviews.Author: jenni
Reviews.Content: I did not have any of the problems the other reviewers had.  Clear picture, going strong after 2 years.  Great price.  Buying a second one for our second child.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely love this product.
Reviews.Author: socershera
Reviews.Content: We absolutely love this product.  We can hear our son so well even with the background noise of the ocean.  We can see him perfectly! The Night vision is great! Only thing we do not like is the static interference when we get too close to our cell phones or internet modem.

Reviews.Title: SPEND MONEY ON ANOTHER MONITOR-TOO MUCH STATIC
Reviews.Author: CP
Reviews.Content: We received this monitor as a gift for our newborn.  The other reviewers are correct when saying that the monitor gives off a lot of interference. The monitor gives off a lot of static noise to where we can't even have the volume turned up at all, which makes the use of this monitor pointless because the whole point of having one is to be able to HEAR your baby.  I would definitely not recommend this monitor to anyone. Spend your money on another monitor.

Reviews.Title: So unbelievably bad
Reviews.Author: Cindy Z "retail goddess"
Reviews.Content: Don't waste your time or money. There was so much frequency interference that it rendered this item completely useless. If a cell phone, cordless phone, radio, or TV is within 15 feet of this thing you get static...And when are you NOT near one of those items? The handheld monitor was nice and granted is made to be toted around but the screen is so small it's a little like watching tv on a postage stamp. There are other, cheaper and better options out on the market, and the MobiCam is a bit of a dud.

Reviews.Title: Waste of money!
Reviews.Author: Jules
Reviews.Content: Bought this monitor and it works well enough as a video monitor but if I have it on it interferes with my Wifi.  So I have the option to either use this or use the internet but not both at the same time.  Tried to troubleshoot with Mobi and they were rude and not helpful at all, they had me try a bunch of different things and wasted so much of my time only to end up saying that they are sorry but I am stuck with a product that is a piece of junk.  I am so frustrated and upset that I am out the money, nothing but horrible things to say about Mobi and their employees!

Reviews.Title: returned it
Reviews.Author: Nessa
Reviews.Content: I used this product as soon as it arrived in the mail, and put it back in the mail the next day.  It turned itself off after a few minutes every time.  I put in fresh batteries (it takes a  ton of batteries!!) but nothing helped.  I ended up purchasing a summer video monitor instead, and I love it.  It was a $100 more, but worth it.  It has a charger, so batteries not necessary which is very nice.  And it works, it doesn't turn off for no reason!

Reviews.Title: RUN AWAY FAST FROM THIS PRODUCT!
Reviews.Author: Chrissy
Reviews.Content: This is a terrible product.  I registered for this and received it as a baby shower gift about 15 months ago (not from Amazon).  The only thing that works well is the night vision.  The static is terrible no matter which room of the house I'm in.  After about two months, I was unable to adjust the volume.  You have to either have the volume off or have it very loud, which is mostly annoying static.  The battery life is terrible...three hours tops.  Both the camera and monitor are very clunky.  It was hard to find an appropriate place to mount the camera and the monitor is very clunky if you're trying to carry it around to do housework.  The little "clip" on the monitor that is supposed to attach to your pocket broke after about four months.  It's so clunky that you could hardly attach it anyway.  My friend has a Summer Infant Best View Handheld Color Video Monitor with 2.5" Screen and I was so jealous of how much nicer it was than this hunk of junk.  Spend the extra money and get a decent one or you will be disappointed.  I will be buying a different product for baby number two!

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Asoeung
Reviews.Content: This was a terrible purchase.  For starters, my husband had to mount it upside down because, when upright, the camera doesn't tilt down more than 45 degrees.  So, in order to mount it upright and have visibility to your baby, it has to be virtually eye-level with your baby.  There was no way we were putting the camera in the crib with our baby, so the alternative was to hang it upside down, only then would the camera tilt to the correct angle.  This rendered the picture on the receiver upside down.  Secondly, we had a terrible issue with static, and our house is not that big.  We would constantly have to move the receiver to new locations where there would be no static.  Lastly, the camera broke after only 2 months of usage.  Unfortunately, we are outside of both the manufacturer's and the store's warranties after 90 days... leaving us out over $130 and with no baby monitor.  I would not recommend this product to anyone.

Reviews.Title: At the time I bought it had great reviews...
Reviews.Author: reviewer
Reviews.Content: I would not buy this monitor again.  When I bought it I read many many reviews and the good seemed to outweigh the bad, but I am not happy with this monitor most of the time.  Sometimes it simply wont pick up a signal, most of the time when this happens I turn it off and on again and it is fine.  Also the camera does not adjust enough for us.  We ended up mounting it to the wall with command adhesive strips so we could actually see our son, and even once we did that it still does not see the whole crib.  The batteries die quickly when used on video mode so we do always keep it plugged in.

Reviews.Title: Absolute crap
Reviews.Author: G. Engolia "G"
Reviews.Content: Let me start out by saying I do not write reviews for things, because I really don't have the time.I registered for this monitor for my baby shower and was really excited when I received it. We started using it this week because our 5 month old has just started sleeping in his own room, and we wanted to be able to check on him. We turned it on and all was well until after about 15 minutes the monitor made a loud static noise and the screen went blank. Confused, I went in his room and noticed the camera had shut itself off. I figured it was just a fluke, so I turned it back on and got back in bed. 30 minutes later the same thing happened. These are not the only problems with this monitor, however:1) Above mentioned issue.2) The static was absolutely unbelievable. Even with no objects around to cause interference, the noise was still there.3) The set only comes with one plug, so you can't choose to plug both the camera and the monitor in at the same time. It's either one or the other.4) They are so light that anything that barely hits them will knock them over. So forget putting them in a crib, pack, and play, or anything.5) The camera doesn't come with anything to attach it to the crib wall. The monitor part does, but why would I need a clip on the monitor? Seems to me the clip should have been on the camera so it could be attached to the side of the pack and play, etc.Needless to say, I would not recommend this product. We are in the process of finding another set.

Reviews.Title: MobiCam
Reviews.Author: Easyshopping
Reviews.Content: The product didn't live up to my expectations.  The clarity of the monitors is very poor (very fuzzy), the manual says you should get reception up to 150ft indoor and 300ft outdoor, I couldn't get reception 20ft away indoor.  I did not keep the item.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for.
Reviews.Author: M. Snatchko "MGS"
Reviews.Content: I bought this 2/19/11 to replace the Summer Day and Night Monitor that I dropped and broke. The Summer was a gift so when I went to compare prices, I couldn't believe how much it had been. This led me to the Mobi. I figured I would sacrifice some quality and initially it's apparent that it is not as nice as the Summer. It is really staticky, the resolution on the LED screen is horrible, and the batteries only last about 5 days (it was plugged in most of the time.) Fast-forward to 3/27/11 and the monitor just stopped working altogether. I replaced the batteries, switched outlets, shook it, nothing! Luckily I still have the Summer one that I can hear the little one. I will be going to Target first thing tomorrow morning and I will shell out $200 for the Summer Infant Best View. And I will duct tape it to myself so I will not drop it! lol. Bottom line, you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Good deal for the price considering the other options...
Reviews.Author: A. Hillary "John-John's Mommy"
Reviews.Content: Received this item as a gift at the baby shower. We got about 7 months use out of this monitor but starting just a couple weeks ago, it has about 2 nights a week where there is no sound or the only sound is loud static. I WAS in love with this product be I had to go get a sound-only monitor for night use when this one isn't working. I am still going to keep this one, though, for the days when it does work and so I can still use the camera part of it which still works well. I wouldn't recommend getting this product for long term use....

Reviews.Title: Horrible Reception
Reviews.Author: denali1116
Reviews.Content: This is the worst baby monitor you could purchase. it gives horrible reception and the picture gets choppy after a few minutes.

Reviews.Title: bad bad camera deal
Reviews.Author: Armando
Reviews.Content: do not buy this one ........not good......at all.....no recieption what so ever.....not a very good item.......if buying one of these pls buy a digital one......just speaking from experience.....

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for!
Reviews.Author: Amy
Reviews.Content: We bought this monitor because it was the lowest cost video monitor we could find. And there is a reason for that! As other reviews state it gets very staticy when anywhere near other electronics. Also when on battery power the batteries don't last long at all. Barely an hour. I would not buy this again.

Reviews.Title: Didn't last a full year
Reviews.Author: CH
Reviews.Content: The other reviews sum it up pretty well.  The screen is very small and it's hard to tell that's it's even in color.  After a few months the receiver stopped working and the warranty is only 90 days.  Buy something else.

Reviews.Title: !!!!!!!THE WORST WAIST OF MONEY!!!!!
Reviews.Author: backwoods barbie
Reviews.Content: I bought this baby monitor to keep an eye on my 2yr old son while he was upstairs in his room playing and it worked great for the first week or two, then I started having issues such as on or the other would turn itself off, go black,or fuzzy and you would have to go up to the baby room and turn off that end and turn it back on as well as the othr end.  I returned the monitor system 3 diffrent times thinking that it was a defaulty monitor but each time the monitor quit working.  In my opinion it is  not worth waisting your time or money on, just go to wal-mart and get one their at least if you choose the wrong one it doesnt cost you to return it.

Reviews.Title: If I could give a half star or none I would
Reviews.Author: able.technician
Reviews.Content: Product frequently loses contact with monitor even just through one wall.  Worst baby purchase I have ever made and I have four kids.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Monitor!
Reviews.Author: M. Koerschner
Reviews.Content: This has to be the worst monitor on the market. I thought I was buying one of the best ones out there after reading some reviews on another site. The monitor worked OK for a while, but I had to have it in exactly the right position so that there was no interference. It got me through my first child, but I was definitely not impressed. A couple years later I pulled it out to use with my second child and there is so much interference now that I cannot use it at all. I have tried to reposition it, add new batteries, tried different locations, but nothing works. I am so mad that I have to go and buy another monitor now. I spent quite a bit of money on this one thinking that it would at least get me through 2 kids - boy was I wrong. Trust the 2 star over-all rating of this product and go with something else! I sure wish I would have.

Reviews.Title: MobiCam Video Monitor
Reviews.Author: Julie Fortner
Reviews.Content: The 1st time I used the monitor it had static and picture was not clear. The 2nd time I used it the LCD did not work. I had only had it for 2 months. I tried to exchange it but it had to be exchanged w/in 45 days. So I called MobiCam Comm. customer service. The cs I talked to was rude while trying to go thur tech issues w/ me. Then she said you can pay to send it in and we we will test it to see what is wrong and we will call you to tell you how much you owe MobiCam Comm. to have it repaired. I let her know that I had only had it for 2 months and that the store would not exchange b/c it was passed the return period. And she cont'd to be rude. So I asked to speak to her supervisor. The supervisor was nice but said the same thing that I had to pay to send it in and pay to have issue resolved. This is no way to treat customers. If they can not replace their product when it it there issue they should not be selling new equipment that they are making people pay to have fixed when it was a manufacturer defect from the begining. Now I have a monitor that does not work b/c I will not pay to send in or pay them to fix their manufactures defect.

Reviews.Title: do not buy
Reviews.Author: Oregon mamacita
Reviews.Content: This worked for less than a month.  Even when it was "working" the interference was so bad as to be barely usable.  We removed any electronic device in the vicinity of the monitor and receiver, to no avail.  Just walking near it or picking up the receiver caused a loud wail of static.  It was cheap, but was not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Where to even begin with my complaints!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have been using this product for 15 months...I have twins so I have been using two cameras and one base since day one.  I am on my third and fourth camera because the night vision went out on both of my monitors and I am in need of a new monitor because there is "dead spots" in the volume dial.I really, really wanted this monitoring system to work.  I bragged and told everyone I knew how GREAT this product was in the first 6 months that I had it.  But that was about how long the honeymoon period lasted.  Then I had to purchase a new monitor because it was actually cheaper to buy a new camera then it was to ship and pay to have the old one fixed.  Then a month later the other camera quit working.  In both the camera the night vision quit working.  So you could still use the cameras as long as you didn't turn the lights out...which of course doesn't work with babies that are trying to sleep.A couple months ago the power cord for the monitor quit working, luckily I was able to use a power cord from one of the two old cameras I still had in a drawer.  And now the sound keeps messing up, I have to find just the right spot for the volume dial because of "dead spots" where you NO sound.  And sometimes the sound will just go away, I turn it off and back on and then it is fine.  But during the middle of the night the last thing I need is for the sound to stop working.Like I said I really wanted to LOVE this system, but it has worked really really hard to make me hate it!  And the I have tried to get customer service from the company and have had no luck.  So it looks like I will get to spend time finding another monitoring system that hopefully will work better for me and my twins...but if I were you I would NOT waste my time or money on this system.

Reviews.Title: Mobicam
Reviews.Author: Cupcake000
Reviews.Content: This camera monitor is horrible!  I should have believed the other reviewers.  It gets way too much static and it barely works with batteries.  When our cordless phone rings it shorts out the monitor.  Now, being only used for 5 weeks, it totally broke! Piece of junk! Getting returned today!

Reviews.Title: Don't Buy it
Reviews.Author: new mom 2010
Reviews.Content: It worked for one use! the receiver still works but the camera stopped working after one use!! are you kidding?! it was a shower gift from my registry and now I am searching for another monitor.

Reviews.Title: Over Priced Paper Weight
Reviews.Author: shan
Reviews.Content: I bought this model last year before I delivered. Within 3 months the internet site wouldn't work well at all. Within 6-8 months the receiver stopped working. So far it has been a very expensive lesson more then anything else.

Reviews.Title: BEWARE OF THIS GARBAGE MONITOR!!!
Reviews.Author: Joshua Lutz
Reviews.Content: Where do I start with this piece of garbage? In a tiny 2 bedroom apt. in Queens NYC it can't even communicate with eachother through a single wall. What kind of useless junk doesn't work through a thin wll 15 feet away? I don't know how this company is in business. When it finally connects it is intermittent at best and also includes a lovely white static with loud buzzing noise when it reconnects which wakes my baby every time. Yet you can't hear it go out, so when my babies crying I don't hear it on the monitor. This single unit has made my first baby year a disaster and I hate this stupid company. The screen is black and white and tiny. Even if it worked it would suck. Don't waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Awful - don't do it!
Reviews.Author: happy customer
Reviews.Content: This monitor is awful.  I sent it back and forth to customer service - at my own cost about 4 times before I gave up.  The night vision rarely works and that static is awful.  I can barely hear my baby over it and I like to use it at night while i'm sleeping - forget sleeping with this thing on.  A huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: It works for me
Reviews.Author: J. Brown
Reviews.Content: I bought this video elsewhere about 8 months ago.  I had a cheap audio only one & decided I that a video monitor would make me feel a lot better.  I didn't want to spend too much money on it.  I got it from another store, a local store.  It does get interference & isn't the best picture, but it works! If the room is too light because it's daytime you just cover the sensor.  If it's grainy just put the camera closer to the baby.  All electronic devices get interference, you can't really help that.  I think that for the cost, compared to others it is worth it.  Just move it to another area if it's getting static & it usually clears up. The B&W; makes things clearer, I can see my baby just fine. I put a sticker over the sensor because that works much better.

Reviews.Title: pay more for a better product to start with
Reviews.Author: Frederick Humberstone
Reviews.Content: After one and a half years our summer infant brand broke. We bought this product due to the affordability of it, we should have paid the extra money and bought another summer infant brand item.  This item has a ton of static sounds, the picture freezes up... we do not sleep well because we are not comfortable not knowing if the screen is frozen and if our child is o.k. or not. Not happy with this product... Now we still have to spend even more money to purchase higher quality brand for a good night sleep.

Reviews.Title: so far so good.
Reviews.Author: LLC
Reviews.Content: Updated: 2 months after purchase.  My biggest complaint though is the volume level. You can turn off the monitor but you can't turn off the sound.  I wish i could just watch the monitor esp when my son is crying since i can hear him despite the volume..we have a small house. The other monitors on the market are definitely more expensive and I don't know for how long I will need this monitor since my son is getting old enough for me not to need it very often.  soo...this will serve its purpose.___________________________________________________________I bought this monitor based on my friends recommendation and I did not read any amazon reviews first...i probably would have been scared off.  So far i've been using this monitor for a few days and it has worked as designed and advertised.Two things I would have preferred:1)the volume control i wish could go lower.  If you have a sound machine on in the baby's room there is no way to make the monitor's volume really low.2) it came with a rechargeable battery pack.  The camera takes  AA and the monitor takes 6. So we always use the A/C plug because I hate going through batteries.Pros:1)I like you can see your baby's eyes and whether or not they are closed.2)unlike some of the reviews i have not experience crazy static. my cell phone does not interfere.3) has an Auto on mode so you can set it and the monitor will not come on unless there is noise from the baby. (although you can't use this function if you have a noise machine in their room.)4) you can turn off the video part and just have it function as a regular monitor if you wish. Nice feature if the monitor is next to your bed at night.  I just turn on the video if i hear my son cry out to see what the situation is before i go in.5)the picture is a good size.  I've seen some monitors that are really small.Hopefully it continues to work well!

Reviews.Title: Don't Bother!
Reviews.Author: Sacramento Shopper "Mary W."
Reviews.Content: I received this as a shower gift.  Currently, we use it just for the video because it is impossible to reply on it for its audio capabilities due to constant static.  We've tried everything to prevent interference, but no matter what we do (unplug our wifi, cordless phones, etc) nothing stops the loud static that comes through. It's unfortunate, because the monitor does have excellent audio capabilities. When the monitor isn't experiencing static, it can pick up the sound of our baby breathing, which is comforting to hear. About every minute or so, there is a loud "BUZZ!" static sound that comes over the audio frequency. This can get annoying if you are trying to sleep and have the sound turned up so you can hear your baby.  If anyone walks anywhere near the monitor, the image gets ever worse and the static gets louder.The  monitor also has horrible problems with reception. The images are always fuzzy and go in and out, like an old television trying to find a signal.I really wanted to like this monitor, but just can't due to all of its problems. I would not recommend this brand!

Reviews.Title: Terrible buzzing - don't waste your money
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: Just like everyone else who gave this a 1-star rating, we are having the same ridiculous problem with the interference. It will work fine for a little bit (could be 10 minutes or 2 hours) and then all of the sudden it will start buzzing really loudly and wake us up. Then you can't get it to stop buzzing. This is a brand new machine! I tried making sure the electrical signal was grounded, and that worked for a bit then the buzzing came back. Then I went and bought batteries thinking that would help if it weren't connected to a power source in the house. But the buzzing still came back. It's like you need to have this thing in an isolated room away from anything electrical, wireless, or anything else for it to work. It's really an awful monitor and no one should buy this product. We can't trust it to allow us to monitor our 3-day old son at night because it will start buzzing and not stop.

Reviews.Title: DO NOT BUY - Horrible Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Pissed New Dad
Reviews.Content: As a pretty saavy tech guy I pride myself in finding a good tech product. Not the case with the MobiCam Monitor System. This thing sucks a$$. No where in my condo do I get a clear and clean connection. There is constant static and the monitor often just switches off.We bought this from Galt Baby in Chicago who are also a bunch of clowns.Don't buy this. Period. You're better of getting a can of Campbell's soup and some string.

Reviews.Title: Not worth it
Reviews.Author: NGP "NGP"
Reviews.Content: I have not been impressed with this product. Both the camera and the receiver are very bulky, but the biggest downside of this monitor is that the receiver does not have a rechargable battery.  We haven't used ours since the batteries ran out.  Of course it will work plugged into the wall and when in use the picture is pretty clear.  There is no night vision feature, which I am definitely looking for in my next monitor.  We also had a difficult time figuring out how to mount this on the wall at the foot of the crib.  This was a learning experience for me in what we really need in a monitor: rechargable battery, acceptable wall mount angle, and night vision.

Reviews.Title: Works great.
Reviews.Author: TMD
Reviews.Content: I have experienced static as others write - but hardly ever!  And I love the night camera.  I think it's a great value.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste your money!
Reviews.Author: Sue Sue
Reviews.Content: Product broke down very quickly on us and has been a HUGE waste of money. It started with receiving lots of static and not getting a clear signal to the picture coming up completely blank. Do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: Another bad experience with video monitors!
Reviews.Author: Jane "Mommy-of-three"
Reviews.Content: Save your money and buy the old fashioned audio monitor!  This is the second video monitor we've owned and it will be the last.  The first one was a Summer Infant Monitor.  The picture and sound were clear, but we quickly realized that not only could we see our baby, we could see every baby on the cul-de-sac.  We returned it to Amazon and replaced it with the MobiCam.  There was no need to worry about seeing the neighborhood children... we could barely see our own, as this thing has such poor picture quality.  The next issue is the awful static that constantly blasts from this monitor.  I incessantly twist and turn it around trying to quiet the commotion of static!  Ten months later, the thing started flashing red, the picture and sound went blank and a hundred bucks is down the drain.  Parents, save your money and buy an audio monitor.  The technology just isn't out there unless you're willing to spend several hundred dollars or more.

Reviews.Title: Dont bother
Reviews.Author: nymommy
Reviews.Content: I received this monitor at my babyshower, it was not the one I registered for but kept it. It has horrible static, which wakes me up at night. The video switches channels out of no where for no reason, the camera is limited so I can only see a certain part of my sons crib.  Now the volume acts up, so I have to hit it to get it to work.  Very cheap, I'm searching for a new one.

Reviews.Title: Stay away from the MobiCam.
Reviews.Author: barnettb99
Reviews.Content: First of all this is not a knock on Amazon because we love and use them often. And secondly I never ever right reviews on products I purchase online but if you are in the same boat we are in with a newborn baby then my wife and I feel that if we can help skip over a mistake purchase than we want to save you guys the headache of returning this product like we did. We were wanting a video monitor for our first baby boy and I searched for a while. After reading reviews this product seemed like a good fit for us. Well it wasn't. There are several things we hated about this unit. First and for most, there is terrible static. The base and camera were less than 20 ft apart. IF someone walked in front of the hand held unit, static or a loud buzz then it went away. If you got too close to the camera, same thing. The hand unit is very bulky and takes 6AA batteries, yes 6! Thankfully we already used rechargeable batteries but it drains them in less than 2 hrs if unplugged from wall adapter. The camera's range of tilt is very limited. You have to have something to sit the camera unit upright on almost directly in front of what you want monitored. The camera also takes several batteries but thankfully we could leave it plugged up at all times. The only thing that worked good on this was the audio when using audio only. But you still had static in it from time to time. WE returned this unit after less than a week and got a refund. Everyone talks about the Summer brand video monitors and they are right. I know they are more expensive but definitely worth it. We got a Summer unit that comes with its own rechargeable battery pack in it and the camera tilts and pans and zooms from the hand unit. The unit we got gos for $175 at Wal-Mart which is way outta our price range but we got lucky and went to a Once Upon a Child store and got it brand new in the box for $60. If you have one of this nearby then I highly recommend you check one out. If not and can stand to spend a little more money then definitively go for the Summer brand monitors. We got the BestView(tm) Handheld Color Video Monitor and it is the most amazing thing ever. We can take the handset anywhere in our house or yard and it has a signal meter right on the set and I've never seen it have less than 3 bars. The MobiCam would barely pick up on the porch without loud distortion unless being put in very specific spots and not moved. All in all I would highly suggest to stay away from this unit. I didnt think the bulkiness would matter but it does. WE didnt think we would pack the hand unit around as much as we do. The Summer unit is sleek and small.

Reviews.Title: Problems from the start
Reviews.Author: KTEC8109
Reviews.Content: Never worked well.  Cord kept popping out, lots of static and then finally began shoring out constantly.  Limped along with it for about a year, but then gave up.  Quality was just not there.

Reviews.Title: BAD PRODUCT
Reviews.Author: natal1994
Reviews.Content: This is such a bad cam it is so hard to see the child and it has so much noise.PLEASE LOOK AT SOMETHING ELSE AND SAVE YOUR MONEY.

Reviews.Title: Piece of Junk
Reviews.Author: Kyda Whitehead
Reviews.Content: I HATE this thing and wish I would have gotten a different one.  for one thing it SUCKS battery's so fast!  would have been nice to have a chargeable handset.  takes 6 AA batteries and if you've got the screen on it'll last like a night.  when my daughter was about 4 months old it started buzzing.  there's this LOVELY buzzing/staticy type noise that makes it almost imposible to hear the baby without turning way up and then annoying yourself with the stupid buzzing.  Now the screen also gets staticy and fuzzy at random times and last night the screen just went blank and no sound randomly.  I'm soo frustrated with this thing!!!  Don't waste your money, other's might be more expensive but they're probably a heck of alot better quality than this piece of junk

Reviews.Title: It does it job.
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Franck
Reviews.Content: Overall this monitor is pretty good. The video and audio is quality is decent. it is portable and support a/v cables if you wish to use a tv for a larger screen.It does have a few draw backs though. The first is that the camera has a limited range of movement so you can not point it looking down. You either have to have it on a table at the same level looking between the bars or you have you mount it upside down on the wall so you can point the camera down. We ended up mounting it upside down and found it didn't make too much of a difference view it upside down.Another drawback is that it appears any less than bright sunlight from outside the night vision kicks in and you won't get color even with overhead light on in the room. We are mostly using it at night however so we would not get color anyway.We also rarely get bursts of static. It unclear what causes it. It may be from out Wi-Fi but is doesn't do it that often and is fine for long periods before it starts up again.Overall though it does do its job as a baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: We like it
Reviews.Author: John Lochaby
Reviews.Content: When my wife was diagnosed with terminal cancer and requested home hospice care, I bought this product. I became her sole 24/7 care-giver.  This product was a huge relief for me because I could continue my normal (relative to the situation) activities and still be there to assist her when I was truly needed.  I never tried battery operation because of the power drain of IR lights and video, but the reviews at the time (late 2006)  were mostly good.  I never had any of the static or battery problems I read about here.  Every part of this system worked as I expected it to work.  I was happy with the quality of the product...and It did exactly what I wanted for four months.  After my Wife passed, My daughter announced she was pregnant.  I gave her the system when my new grand son was born.  My daughter and her husband used it for another 8 to 10 months and loved it.  They had no issues with it.I am considering buying another complete MOBI system for security and placing it to view my front door.  The only problem I have with this unit is the small size of the monitor.  Unless you can position the monitor at very close range, you can not see it.

Reviews.Title: Do not Buy
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey A Davis
Reviews.Content: This monitor has constant reception issues.  Most the time I can not hear our baby crying over the static.  I have tried everythiing to get it to work correctly.  I am currently looking for just a clear voice monitor.  I find that I dont watch the screen as much as I thought I would. Voice is plenty to let me know when my little guy is awake.

Reviews.Title: Very static
Reviews.Author: Me
Reviews.Content: The picture goes in and out very static takes 6 aa batteries to use un plugged not worth the money but you get what u pay for

Reviews.Title: Junk out of the box... pretty decent after antenna mod!
Reviews.Author: jaytango
Reviews.Content: Like everyone else, this thing was very staticky and noisy out of the box. Barely usable. After opening it up and soldering an 8-inch thin solid copper wire to the transmitter's internal antenna it works like a charm. Good reception throughout house. BTW, the internal antenna is in the top, by the camera ball and looks like a spring.

Reviews.Title: Visual is great/Sound needs improvement
Reviews.Author: Laura G. Oneal-kemp "Aslaurais"
Reviews.Content: We've been using this monitor for nearly 8 months. We are pleased with the image (and online-streaming ability when we've used it)although the sound needs improved greatly among other things! We actually use another monitor for the sound and turn the Mobi's sound off! Another thing that needs improved is the ability to screw the camera into a wall or high up place. My baby is crawling, and pulling up onto everything so I had to quickly remove the camera from a make shift table that was holding the camera beside his crib. We are using a floating shelf above the crib now and rigged it to view half of his crib. I wish we were able to see more (wider angle lense?). I wish we had researched more and bought a different camera but a year ago this was the only one available.

Reviews.Title: Fickle, also drains batteries quickly
Reviews.Author: APL418
Reviews.Content: This product basically does the job, but it can be fickle.  There are many times when the screen will go blue for no reason and the sound shuts off.  We live in a relatively compact 3 bedroom apartment, so we can hear when our son cries and it isn't a huge deal.  Still, it is frustrating (especially when my son was younger and I was much more nervous about those sorts of things!).  The picture is better when it is completely dark or completely light -- the picture is hard to see when there is partial light.  Recently, we've even been having some problems with the clarity of the picture when it is dark.  Since it doesn't mount to the wall, it is convenient to bring to the grandparents' house.  The downside of the no mounting is that we needed to build a special shelf just to hold the camera.  There are probably better products out there.

Reviews.Title: Great product- worth the money
Reviews.Author: Kris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I love this monitor. It allows us to put the baby to bed at night, and if we hear a peep from him, we can easily see if he is actually awake or just making typical baby noises while he sleeps, so we don't need to constantly go into his room to check on him. I also like that you can plug it into the wall or put batteries in it to make it portable.  There is a little static with the receiver, but I have never heard a baby monitor that doesn't have static; it is not bothersome, and we just adjust the volume to our liking. The night vision is fabulous. I would recommend this monitor to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Worked ok at first, then downhill
Reviews.Author: M. Manka
